articles.title: DPRK Foreign Ministry Spokesman Refutes Senior U.S. Diplomat's Remarks on Dialogue with DPRK
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Ministry Spokesman Refutes Senior U.S. Diplomat's Remarks on Dialogue with DPRK 
						
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA Sunday as regards the fact that the U.S. is working hard to shift the blame for the failure to hold dialogue with the DPRK onto the latter:
					 Kim Song, special representative for north Korea policy of the U.S. Department of State, in an interview during his tour of China on Jan. 30 let loose a spate of outbursts that the U.S. always keeps the door of dialogue for engagement and denuclearization open.
					
					 This is a foolish attempt of the U.S. to fan up an atmosphere of sanctions and pressure on the DPRK through "international cooperation" by shifting the blame for the failure to hold dialogue and negotiations for the settlement of the issue of the Korean peninsula onto the DPRK.
					
					 As well known to the world, entering the new year, the DPRK made bold and flexible proposals to defuse the danger of war, ease tension and create a peaceful climate on the Korean peninsula and is making every possible sincere effort to put them into practice.
					
					 It clarified its stand that it is ready to take responding steps for putting a moratorium on nuclear test, a concern of the U.S.,  in case the latter temporarily halts joint military exercises in south Korea and its vicinity.
					
					 It, at the same time, clarified that it is ready to sit at a negotiating table with the U.S. any time. 
					
					 It also invited Kim Song to visit Pyongyang as he expressed his willingness to meet with his counterpart of the DPRK during his visit to Asia this time.
					
					 However, the U.S., in disregard of this, is working hard to shift the blame onto the DPRK, misleading public opinion by creating impression that dialogue and contacts are not realized due to the latter's insincere attitude.
					
					 While talking about dialogue, Kim insisted on the stance that the DPRK should first take its sincere attitude toward denuclearization if dialogue is to start. This means, in essence, refusing dialogue as it is aimed to disarm the dialogue partner, first of all.
					
					 Even the U.S. president openly said that it would bring down the social system in the DPRK. It is preposterous and a height of American-style shamelessness and hypocrisy to claim that the U.S. keeps the door of dialogue with the DPRK open. 
					
					 The DPRK feels no need to sit at a negotiating table with the party totally denying the ideology and social system chosen by the Korean people and desperately working to bring down them.
					
					 The DPRK will resolutely counter the U.S. as long as it refuses to make its Korea policy switch and seeks "collapse of system" in the DPRK.

articles.title: Activities for Creating Literary Works Brisk
articles.content:
Activities for Creating Literary Works Brisk
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Writers Union of Korea is conducting brisk activities for creating literary works encouraging the army and people in their dynamic drive to decorate the grand October festival with signal successes.
					 Poets of the poetry panel of the committee went to production sites alive with labor drive including the Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill and the East Pyongyang Thermal Power Plant.
					
					 They created many works including poems "May the country leap higher" and "Advance towards Grand October festival".
					
					 Writers of the novel panel created more than 10 essays including "Sound of blizzards on Mt. Paektu." They powerfully inspire the working people in their all-out charge for bringing earlier the final victory.
					
					 They are creating works on the greatness of the peerless great men and at least 10 literary works.
					
					 The drama and juvenile literature panel is proving successful in the work to find seeds of works in the reality and create literary pieces suited to the aspiration of the people and their aesthetic taste.
					
					 Writers of the classical literature panel are devoting their enthusiasm to creating works dealing with the time-honored history and culture of the Korean nation, while channeling efforts into comprehensively arranging heritages of classical literature.

articles.title: Minju Joson Blasts U.S. Human Rights Abuses
articles.content:
Minju Joson Blasts U.S. Human Rights Abuses
						
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed recently that a unit of the U.S. police conducted a shooting exercise, using photos of living black people as targets. This shocking incident sparked off uproar throughout the U.S.
					Minju Joson on Sunday observes in a commentary in this regard: The above-said fact goes to prove that the U.S. is a veritable hell and a tundra of human rights as inhuman vices and a jungle logic are rampant there.
					
					  The idea of hating and despising black people is deeply rooted in the U.S.  from a historical point of view and maltreatment of them is commonplace there.
					
					 Black Americans are ill-treated and leading a miserable life, subject to all sorts of social contempt and humiliation for the mere reason that they are black.
					
					 What matters is that the present black president of the U.S. is incapable of dealing with this social vice.
					
					 People mock at the U.S. where persons are estimated with race as a standard and where thieves are treated as gentlemen and guiltless people are branded as criminals according to races, terrible mayhem.
					
					 The responsibility for this pandemonium entirely rests with the bourgeois capitalists and the politicians of the U.S., their servants.
					
					 The U.S. is ridden with inequality and contradictions as people are subject to maltreatment and insult for being blacks, women and Muslims.
					
					 It is bound to face a stern punishment of history.

articles.title: Japan's Settlement of Its Past Crimes Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Japan's Settlement of Its Past Crimes Demanded in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea held the 1163rd Wednesday rally in Seoul on Jan. 28, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 Yun Mi Hyang, permanent representative of the council, deplored that a grandmother, whose chastity had been mercilessly violated by Japanese soldiers after being drafted as one of comfort women for the Imperial Japanese Army, died on Jan. 26 with her grudge unsettled.
					
					 She called on people from various circles to stage dynamic actions to force the Japanese government to make an apology and reparation for the sexual slavery.
					
					 Then a statement was read out.
					
					 It denounced the Japanese government for still denying the sexual slavery, tampering with history and evading responsibility for the past crimes, brazen-faced behavior.
					
					 It noted that they would carry on their Wednesday rally till the Japanese government atones for the sexual slavery.

articles.title: Chongryon Officials Call for Making Breakthrough towards National Reunification
articles.content:
Chongryon Officials Call for Making Breakthrough towards National Reunification
						
 Tokyo, January 31 (KNS-KCNA) -- Chairpersons of headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) released statements in support of the appeal made at the joint meeting of the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK.
					 Pak Jong Song, chairman of the Hokkaido Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon, said that Korea's reunification linked with the happiness of the Koreans in Japan who have suffered pain of the national division for 70 years in an alien land.
					
					 Pu Yong Uk, chairperson of the Osaka Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon, said that now is the time for all Koreans to display their wisdom and energies by getting united in the idea of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					 Mun Kwang Hui, chairperson of the Aichi Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon, noted that all the officials and compatriots under the headquarters will dynamically advance to defuse the danger of a war and create a peaceful atmosphere on the Korean Peninsula and bringing about a turn in the movement for national reunification through the great national unity.
					
					 Ri Thae Hyong, chairman of the Hiroshima Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon, called for putting an end to  the U.S. and south Korean war maniacs' frantic nuclear war drills and boldly paving a new avenue to repairing the north-south relations and achieving peaceful reunification. 
					
					 Ri Ju Hak, chairman of the Fukuoka Prefectural headquarters of Chongryon, called on the officials and compatriots under the headquarters to wage a dynamic drive for making a breakthrough for national reunification this significant year marking the 15th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration, the 70th anniversary of national liberation and the 60th anniversary of the formation of Chongryon, in response to the appeal of the joint meeting.

articles.title: DPRK's Access to Nukes Is Product of U.S. Hostile Policy toward It: Russian Expert
articles.content:
DPRK's Access to Nukes Is Product of U.S. Hostile Policy toward It: Russian Expert
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's access to nukes is a product of the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK, said Alexander Zhebin, director of the Center for the Korean Studies of the Institute of the Far East of the Russian Academy of Sciences.
					 He referred to the confab of the U.S., Japan and south Korea on the policy toward the DPRK held in Tokyo on January 28.
					
					 Recalling that the U.S. is expecting a new nuclear test to take place in the DPRK, he explained the reason as follows:
					
					 The U.S. seeks to justify its unilateral sanctions which have already been partially enforced and the additional ones to be slapped.
					
					 It is also mulling putting monetary and trade sanctions to isolate the DPRK through the UN Security Council.
					
					 The U.S. imposed additional sanctions upon Pyongyang under the pretext of the cyber attack on the Sony Pictures Entertainment.
					
					 This is the first proposal among a package of new sanctions against the DPRK adopted at the U.S. House of Representatives in summer last year. The DPRK is not the only target of those sanctions.
					
					 Their final aim is to make the economic conditions of the DPRK difficult.
					
					 He noted that the U.S. and its followers found themselves in a difficult position as the DPRK made a peace proposal, a new card, contrary to their measure.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 It is the public opinion that the U.S. attitude of denying the peace proposal made by the DPRK without any condition will strain the situation on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 William Bright, U.S. senator, termed the U.S. attitude "arrogance of power".
					
					 Due to this "arrogance of power," in other words, the U.S. policy of disregarding the DPRK's concern over security compelled the latter to have access to nuclear weapons.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised Abroad
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Organizations and institutions of various countries posted articles on their websites to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism on Jan. 23 posted an article titled "Kim Jong Il, exploits he performed for building of WPK ", which said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il led the Workers' Party of Korea for decades, performing distinguished exploits.
					
					 The greatest of the exploits was that he developed the party into an ideologically transparent integral whole and the party which achieved the perfect unity and cohesion of its members.
					
					 He always regarded it as an important requirement for the building of the party to achieve the unity and cohesion of all its members and successfully attained them.
					
					 As a result, the party achieved unity in thinking and purpose, morality and sense of obligation based on a monolithic idea and center and fully demonstrated its invincible might as a force guiding the Korean society.
					
					 Another distinguished exploit was that he built the WPK into the genuine mother party serving the people.
					
					 Those exploits performed by him will shine forever along with the ever-victorious WPK.
					
					 The Peru-Korea Institute of Culture and Friendship on Jan. 21 posted articles including one titled "Kim Jong Il's patriotism" on its website to praise him for performing great exploits for the country and its people and making great contributions to the socialist cause and the cause of global independence.
					
					 Kim Jong Il Library and the Juche Youth Group in Ecuador jointly posted articles on a website praising his sacred revolutionary career and exploits.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Marked in Benin, Germany
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Marked in Benin, Germany
						
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Events took place in foreign countries from Jan. 21 to 23 to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 They included a meeting and seminar in Benin and round-table talks and film show in Germany.
					
					 Films shown included Korean films "Pyongyang Today" and "Fireworks of a Thriving Nation."
					
					 Ali Houdou, president of the Socialist Party of Benin, praised Kim Jong Il for leading the DPRK to victory, weathering all trials of history by dint of ideology. He added that Kim Jong Il turned the DPRK into an impregnable fortress.
					
					 Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said it was an event to be specially recorded in the history of the human cause of independence that Kim Jong Il formulated the revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung as an integral system of idea, theory and method of Juche. 
					
					 Michael Koth, chairman of the Anti-imperialist Forum of Germany, said Kim Jong Il performed great feats for the reunification of Korea and world peace and stability.
					
					 He expressed conviction that under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un the Korean people would fulfill the behests of Kim Jong Il and proudly build a thriving socialist nation and surely accomplish the historic cause of national reunification in the near future.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Kyrgyz Political Party Leader
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Kyrgyz Political Party Leader 
						
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The great Comrade Kim Jong Il was the outstanding leader who consolidated the single-minded unity of the DPRK. 
					 A. Usupbayev, chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party and chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Kyrgyzstan, said this in a statement on January 26. 
					
					The statement went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il was deeply revered and trusted by the Korean people for his shining ideological and theoretical wisdom, distinguished leadership ability and noble traits. 
					
					 He developed in depth the Songun idea based on the Juche idea and formulated the Songun politics based on it as the main socialist political mode and weathered adversity by dint of Songun. 
					
					 The service personnel and people of the DPRK defended socialism and opened up a fresh turning phase for building a thriving nation, united close around him. 
					
					 The single-minded unity of the DPRK achieved by President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il is now growing stronger under the leadership of respected Comrade Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK. 
					
					 We are confident that the Korean people will surely win the final victory with the might of single-minded unity stronger than nuclear weapons in the future.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Commemorated by Guinean Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Commemorated by Guinean Organization
						
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Guinean preparatory committee for celebrating the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star issued its bulletin on Jan. 26 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The bulletin in an article titled "Snow and Kim Jong Il" said:
					
					 Snow comes to our minds, to begin with, when thinking of the whole life of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					
					 He was born in February when snow fell on Mt. Paektu, a holy mountain of the Korean revolution, and parted forever from the people, being exposed to snow in December.
					
					 His life was characterized by philosophy on snow.
					
					 He led a simple life. His noble career will be always remembered by the Korean people and progressive mankind.
					
					 Under the headline "Undying Songun feats" the bulletin edited the following article:
					
					 The Songun revolutionary leadership of HE Kim Jong Il ushered in a new era of prosperity unprecedented in the history of the Korean nation spanning five thousand years.
					
					 He turned the DPRK into a political and ideological power of single-minded unity and put its military capability onto the highest level by providing Songun leadership.
					
					 An epochal turn took place in the economic development of the DPRK under his leadership.
					
					 His Songun revolutionary leadership is being successfully carried forward by HE Kim Jong Un.
